title: Phantom ICE: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 190 but the index is 40260'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
As the title suggests, the ICE was "phantom" i.e. after I ran `cargo r` for a second-time compilation succeeded without problems. As such, I can't provide MRE. The ICE happened while I was compiling edited `11-usart` example from the [Discovery Book][book]. The exact version of the code can be found in [my fork]. [book]: https://docs.rust-embedded.org/discovery/11-usart/index.html [my fork]: https://github.com/WaffleLapkin/discovery/tree/34b4df1e1e9291a909594380bf122518b6ca884b/src/11-usart ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.55.0-nightly (240ff4c4a 2021-07-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 240ff4c4a0d0936c9eeb783fa9ff5c0507a6ffb4 commit-date: 2021-07-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.55.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output
Error/Backtrace
